intro: Lithocarpus rufovillosus, commonly known as the rusty-haired evergreen oak, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its hard, dense wood and evergreen foliage. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant produces small, inedible nuts enclosed in a thick, leathery shell, similar to other members of its family. Its leaves are typically elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive rusty-brown pubescence on the underside. This species is valued for its durable timber and plays an important ecological role in its native habitats.
